newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Mobil Singapore to raise output during turnaround.
newsitem.headline: Mobil Singapore to raise output during turnaround.

text.p: Mobil Singapore plans to shut down its 280,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery for maintenance for six weeks from March 15, an industry source said on Thursday.
The source said during the turnaround, Mobil plans to debottleneck its capacity to 300,000-bpd which would make the US major's refinery the second largest in Singapore.
Mobil may however keep a smaller 45,000-bpd crude distillation unit (CDU) open during the maintenance period, the source said.
"We will only make an offcial announcement closer to the turnaround," said the company spokesman.
Mobil's last scheduled turnaround at its Jurong refinery on the west coast was at the end of November 1995 when a 40,000-bpd CDU and a 86,000-bpd vacuum distillation unit were closed for seven days.
